channel.title: [Tutorial] Creating and using a JSON serializer in Java
channel.description:
Here's a tutorial I wrote because I couldn't really find too much information on JSON serialization when I was trying to figure out how to do it.
[url=http://jamesmonger.com/post/creating-and-using-a-json-serializer-in-java.html]Creating and using a JSON serializer in Java[/url]
Any feedback is appreciated, I hope some of you find it helpful!

item.title: [Tutorial] Creating and using a JSON serializer in Java
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:18, topic:547023”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=665921.msg4451943#msg4451943 date=1412171533]

[quote author=Ruby link=topic=665921.msg4451941#msg4451941 date=1412170516]

holy fudge that profile photo

I’ve only ever seen two men with two ear piercings. One was a poof and one was a pirate, and I don’t see a ship in that photo.
[/quote]. Only have one in that photo son
[/quote]Looks like two on the left ear bruh[/quote]

Haha yeah I noticed that. I was wearing a black one and the tree behind looks like another earring. I only have one piercing per lobe.

I’ve got a new theme and have written a new tutorial!

Read full topic

item.title: [Tutorial] Creating and using a JSON serializer in Java
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

try (Writer writer = new FileWriter(Game.getPlayerFolder()+ p.getName() + ".json")) { writer.write(gson.toJson(p)); writer.close(); }
Since you’re using the try resource the writer stream will be automatically closed when finishing the block.
You don’t need to put .close();

Read full topic
item.source: [Tutorial] Creating and using a JSON serializer in Java

item.title: [Tutorial] Creating and using a JSON serializer in Java
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:10, topic:547023”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=665921.msg4451879#msg4451879 date=1412119496]

I though you where going to save the object lol, saving entries like this is simple and can be done in any format.

ORM all the way!

I did save the object…

I was viewing it on my phone and it looked like you manually selected what fields you wanted to save. Saving the whole object is bad btw >.< depending on situation. I know one guy who was saving every instance linked with Player.

I did, kind of. How else would I do it? I’m not sure of a way to serialize a custom object without writing a serializer for it.

You can use the built in serialiser but that wouldn’t save to json. I’ve seen people use annotations to mark what they wanted saved but for whatever yes you’d need to write something for what you want.

If you took my advice, screw json and use SQL. Il make a tutorial one day on how life could be made easier ;D
[/quote]
I’ve used SQL before but I find JSON to be a lot easier to work with, especially for small projects.

@Hco, the post can now be found at http://jamesmonger.com/post/creating-and-using-a-json-serializer-in-java.html

Also, I’ve added syntax highlighting. It took a bit of a hackjob to get it in but it uses Google’s Prettify.[/quote]

Cool. I agree with HcoJustin about getting a new theme haha.

Also, I noticed that your code snippets overflow outside the box when they get a bit long, so add in a overflow: auto; to your CSS pre code rule and you should be golden.

Read full topic
item.source: [Tutorial] Creating and using a JSON serializer in Java

item.title: [Tutorial] Creating and using a JSON serializer in Java
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“justaguy, post:4, topic:547023”]It’s good to see someone make a blog on programming here! Employers like seeing this kind of stuff so keep it up.
As for the article itself, you forgot to add the link for the GSON library in this sentence,

I’m going to be using Google’s GSON library for this tutorial, you can download it here.

Also, consider getting a syntax highlighter?[/quote]

Definitely so, I’m mainly writing this to show potential employers and universities when I apply. Thanks for catching that, I wrote the article out in the WYSIWYG editor that came with the CMS and then switched it to markdown, forgetting the link. I’ll be looking into a syntax highlighter, too.

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:5, topic:547023”]?action=view&url=creating-and-using-a-json-serializer-in-java
Bad SEO![/quote]
Thanks, fixing soon.

Read full topic
